metadata.feature_description: Search pages with multiple filters including page type, tags, publish status, date range, and workflow

steps.action: Navigate to Pages Search and expand Advanced Filters
steps.expected: Advanced Filters panel should be visible with filter options
steps.actual: Advanced Filters panel expanded showing Page Type, Publish Status, Date Range, Workflow, and Tags filters

steps.expected: Dropdown should show page type options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed options: None, Standard, Existing, URL, File

steps.expected: Results should filter to show only Standard page type pages
steps.actual: Results filtered to 63 pages, all showing Page Type: Standard

steps.expected: Dropdown should show publish status options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed options: None, Published, Draft

steps.expected: Results should filter to show only Draft status pages
steps.actual: Results filtered to 28 pages with Publish Status: Draft

steps.action: Clear filters and enter 'test' in Tags field
steps.expected: Tag should be entered in the Tags filter field

steps.action: Click Apply to filter by tag
steps.expected: Results should filter to pages with the specified tag or show no results if no pages have that tag
steps.actual: No pages found with 'test' tag - displayed 'NO PAGE FOUND.' message

steps.action: Apply filter that returns no results (tag filter with non-existent tag)
steps.expected: System should display appropriate 'no results found' message
steps.actual: System displayed 'NO PAGE FOUND.' message when no pages matched the filter criteria

steps.expected: Dropdown should show available workflow options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed workflow options: None, Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Approval Workflow, QA Test Workflow, Test <Special> & "Chars"

steps.action: Select 'Content Approval' workflow and click Apply
steps.expected: Results should filter to pages with Content Approval workflow
steps.actual: Results filtered to 28 pages, all showing Workflow: Content Approval

steps.action: Clear filters and click on date range picker icon
steps.expected: Date range picker calendar should open
steps.actual: Date range picker opened showing two calendars for selecting start and end dates

steps.action: Select date range 12/27/2025 - 01/09/2026 and click Apply
steps.expected: Results should filter to pages published within the date range
steps.actual: Results filtered to 35 pages with publish dates within the selected range

steps.action: Apply date range filter (12/27/2025 - 01/09/2026) and Publish Status filter (Published)
steps.expected: Results should show only pages matching both filter criteria
steps.actual: Results filtered to 35 pages that are both Published AND within the date range

steps.action: Verify combined filter results show correct values
steps.expected: All displayed pages should have Published status and publish date within range
steps.actual: All visible pages show Publish Status: Published and Publish Date: 12/27/2025 which is within the selected range

steps.action: Observe search results display with multiple pages (35+ pages)
steps.expected: Results should display with some form of pagination or scrolling
steps.actual: Search results displayed in a scrollable list view showing all 35 pages. The UI uses infinite scroll rather than traditional page number pagination. The API supports pageIndex and pageSize parameters for pagination.

observations: The SearchPages API supports pagination via pageIndex and pageSize parameters, but the UI displays results in a scrollable list view rather than traditional paginated navigation with page numbers.
All filter dropdowns (Page Type, Publish Status, Workflow) include a 'None' option to clear the filter selection.
The date range filter automatically sets the end date to the current date when selecting a start date.
The Tags filter accepts free-form text input rather than selecting from predefined options.
Workflow filter shows all available workflows including system workflows (Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval) and custom workflows.
The Advanced Filters panel is collapsible and shows current filter values when collapsed.
